text:
In my httpd.conf I've got one VHost which has its DocumentRoot set to Y:\ which
is a network device.

When I try to start Apache, the Windows SystemLog says:

| The Apache service named  reported the following error:
| >>> Syntax error on line 314 of C:/www/apache/conf/httpd.conf:     .

| The Apache service named  reported the following error:
| >>> DocumentRoot must be a directory     .

Syntax of httpd.conf is correct and the directory exists!

When starting the Apache in a DOS-Window all works as aspected and no errors are
returned.

System is WinXP with Apache 2.0.52 but it also occoured in older versions of 2.x

If you are running the Apache service with the LocalSystem account (which is the default), it will have no 
access to network devices. This is explained in some detail in the Apache on Windows platform notes 
(http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/platform/windows.html).

If you decide to run Apache as a specific user, as recommended in those notes for the case where you 
need to use network devices, you should be aware that drive mappings are user-specific, so there is no 
guarantee that Y: will do what you expect (or be mapped to anything). Use of UNC paths is highly 
recommended (by me, anyway.)
